page.title: 02ECOLOGY OF RHU.
page.content: Our area is surrounded by fairly steep_sided hills with the mountains of the Highlands towering above us to the north.It is a rather wet,but generally mild area with an average annual rainfall of 1416mm with most falling in October.The maximum temperature so far this year has been 23.5'C recorded on June 2nd and the minimum of _11'C in January.Leaving the village green,we ascend the hill and soon pass through wooded areas in which there is a greater percentage of deciduous trees than conifers with the main species being beech,sycamore, silver birch and ash, in the shade of which grow bluebells and ferns in profusion. Higher still, we come to rough grazing pastures with the occasional cluster of oak trees.From here,one can look down upon the Gareloch and the Firth of Clyde.
